contentencoded: If you're listening to this broadcast via a solar-powered radio on a dusty desert expanse, you're probably at Burning Man. The festival celebrating arts and alternative culture in the Nevada Desert is in full swing this week. It's long been a venue for massive fire-breathing sculptures, strange desert vehicles, and a no-cash bartering economy. But it's also become a big meeting spot for big wigs from the tech industry. And, while thinking outside of the box is a common goal for both techies and so-called "burners," the tech presence at Burning Man is ruffling some feathers. Russell Brandom, reporter for website The Verge, explains why.
description: The alternative culture festival is big among the tech scene.
